pullRequest.title: [F] ENT-1829: Populate provided products and derived provided products
pullRequest.bodyText:
into org.candlepin.dto.rules.v1.PoolDTO from product model

Updated Pool Translator, JUnit and rspec files.

nodes.bodyText: These need to be n-tier aware translations
Add the provided product to the product itself up on line 2208.
Add these to the product directly during product declaration.

This should also add the derived_provided_products here. And the create_mkt_product_and_pools method should now stop adding those. Also, this is part of another task (ENT-1834), so if it's going to be in this PR we should also add it to the commit & PR summary to reflect that.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -207,7 +207,8 @@ def create_product(cp, owner, product)
     :attributes => attrs,
     :dependentProductIds => dependent_products,
     :relies_on => relies_on,
-    :branding => branding
+    :branding => branding,
+    :providedProducts => provided_products

nodes.bodyText: I'm unsure of what this does? Is it needed?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -809,7 +809,7 @@ def create_product(owner_key, id, name, params={})
       'dependentProductIds' => dependentProductIds,
       'branding' => branding,
       'reliesOn' => relies_on,
-      'providedProducts' => providedProducts.collect { |pid| {'id' => pid} },
+      'providedProducts' => providedProducts.collect { |pid| {'id' => pid} || pid}

nodes.bodyText: @Ceiu Can you explain what you mean by "n-tier aware"?

nodes.bodyText:
I don't think the new method resolveProvidedProducts is needed. We could simply use the existing resolveProduct/resolveProducts methods to lookup any existing provided products we have, assuming they were already created.
spec tests would have to make sure that the provided products are created first, and then create a marketing product that references them.
The only reason the resolveBranding method was created this way was because you can't really create a branding standalone. It is an entity fully owned by a product.
